jobsJson.descriptionPlain: This person will be reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) the successful candidate will be accountable for the ongoing development and management of information security policies, procedures, and technical systems in order to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and information systems that store and/or process Gojek data. In addition you will be accountable to develop and manage data privacy governance for the organization.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• This leader is accountable for the design, implementation and maintenance of the Data Security Program, which defines required protections to the processing of “sensitive data” including “personal identifiable information” based on regulatory requirements as well as for cyber risk management - development and maintenance of Gojek’s Data Security and Privacy Program, which includes privacy policies, program documents, guidance, and procedures
  • Perform ongoing data and/or privacy risk assessments to ensure that information systems are adequately protected and meeting regulatory certification requirements
  • Assess and interpret regulatory requirements for the security and privacy of data
  • Identify incident trends related to risks to the privacy of Sensitive Data / Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and develops strategies to manage and mitigate those risks
  • Collaborates with strategic partners including the data governance team to assess the security of related systems, define controls to manage security-related risks, to ensure regulatory compliance, to align security and privacy practices, and to adapt policies, approaches, and standards to evolving technological challenges
  • Help define Gojek’s internal data security posture, with a focus on helping the company ensure that sensitive data is protected against unauthorized access and distribution
  • Responsible to integrate data security and privacy controls in technology, business organization structure, IT infrastructure, applications, procedures, legal and regulatory requirements, evolving threats and vulnerabilities. 
  • Give periodic updates to senior management, regulators, on Gojek’s posture of data security and privacy controls - Report to management on data-related or privacy regulatory developments or instances of non-compliance
  • Ensure Gojek addresses incidents involving SDI / PII in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements for notification to regulators and/or impacted individuals
  • Develop security and privacy policies including for where consent from individuals is required for processing of personal information, the method for obtaining consent (e.g. Opt-in, Opt-out, etc.) and management of consent
  • Development, maintenance and delivery of related communications and data security awareness training to internal users. Create general and targeted training related to data protection and privacy
  • Establish and maintain policies to respond to valid data subject requests (access, deletion, correction, etc.) and privacy-related incident investigation and response activities
  • Development of content and approval of policies within the data security and privacy program
  • Determination of when incidents require notification to individuals, clients and/or regulators

• 10+ years of experience in the various security disciplines (e.g., Data Security, Privacy program and policy, information security, information governance, incident response, information security, training and awareness, etc.)
  • A working knowledge of how to establish a data security and/or privacy program including how to achieve business alignment, data governance, data subject inquiry and compliant handling processes
  • A knowledge of data security and privacy frameworks and how to organize privacy policies and program activities (education, monitoring, data inventories, etc.)
  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to Privacy, including but not limited to GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA and the NIST standards or equivalent
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills including experience in Audit/Compliance/Regulatory discussions
  • B.A. or B.S. degree in Information Security, Computer Science or equivalent work experience in Information Security, Privacy, Compliance, information security, audit or related field
  • Experience leading security-related program development and/or risk management
  • Experience leading teams and working in highly matrixed environments
  • Must be able to collaborate with domestic and international teams
  • Interpret relevant regulations and understand how to adapt to regulatory changes

• Present to senior executives and the board about the status of data security and/or privacy initiatives
  • Monitor local and global regulatory developments related to privacy
  • Develop and regularly update internal policies related to privacy
  • Collaborate with new product and engineering teams to integrate security and privacy into product design
  • Ability to adapt to a fast-moving data and systems landscape and keep pace with latest thinking and newest security technologies
